info.title: Maintenance Order Events
info.description:
Maintenance orders describe in detail the maintenance tasks that are to be performed on a technical object and provide all the information needed to plan and execute maintenance work. 

The following events are available for maintenance order: 
* Approved
* Closed
* Rejected
* Set to Ready for execution
* Set to deletion flagged
* Set to in planning
* Set to in preparation
* Set To Work Not Performed
* Set To Maintenance Work Completed
* Set To Work Started
* Set to Ready to schedule
* Set to technical completed
* Set to Work done
* Submitted for approval
* Order Phase Control Activated
* Order Phase Control Deactivated
* Operation Phase Control Activated
* Operation Phase Control Deactivated

x-sap-shortText: Informs a remote system about closed, approved, and rejected events for maintenance orders in an SAP S/4HANA Cloud tenant.

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.Approved.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is only raised for maintenance orders that are processed according to phases. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase Approved (Order).

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.Closed.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is raised for maintenance orders of all order types. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase Closed (Order) or when the system status has been set to Closed.

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.OpPhseCtrlActvtd.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is raised when a phase control on the operation level is activated.

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.OpPhseCtrlDactvtd.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is raised when a phase control on the operation level is deactivated.

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.OrdPhseCtrlActvtd.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is raised when a phase control on the header level is activated.

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.OrdPhseCtrlDactvtd.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is raised when a phase control on the header level is deactivated.

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.Rejected.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is only raised for maintenance orders that are processed according to phases. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase Rejected (Order).

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.SetReadyForExec.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is only raised for maintenance orders that are processed according to phases. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase Ready for Execution (Order).

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.SetToDeletnFlagged.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is only raised for maintenance orders that are processed according to phases. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase Deletion Flag (Order).

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.SetToInPlanning.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is raised for maintenance orders of all order types. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase In Planning (Order) or when the system status has been set to Created.

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.SetToInPreparation.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is raised for maintenance orders of all order types. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase In Preparation (Order) or when the system status has been set to Released.

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.SetToMainWorkCmplt.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.summary: MaintenanceOrder Set To Maintenace Work Completed
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is only raised for maintenance orders that are processed according to phases. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase Main Work Completed (Order).

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.SetToRdyForSchedg.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.summary: MaintenanceOrder Set To Ready For Scheduling
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is only raised for maintenance orders that are processed according to phases. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase Ready to Schedule (Order).

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.SetToTechCompleted.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is raised for maintenance orders of all order types. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase Technically Complete (Order) or when the system status has been set to Technically Completed.

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.SetToWorkDone.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is only raised for maintenance orders that are processed according to phases. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase Work Done (Order).

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.SetToWorkStarted.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is only raised for maintenance orders that are processed according to phases. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase Main Work Started (Order).

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.SetToWrkNotPerfrmd.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.summary: MaintenanceOrder Set To Work Not Performed
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is raised for maintenance orders of all order types. The event is raised when the maintenance order has reached the subphase Work Not Performed (Order) or when the system status has been set to Do Not Execute.

sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.name: sap.s4.beh.maintenanceorder.v1.MaintenanceOrder.SubmdForApproval.v1
sap_s4_beh_maintenanceorder_v1_Maintenan.description: This event is only raised for maintenance orders that are processed according to phases. The event is raised when the order has reached the subphase Submitted for Approval (Order).

MaintenanceOrder.description:
# Definition

Key that uniquely identifies an **order** within a **client**.

MaintenanceOrderType.description:
# Definition

Key that differentiates **orders** according to their purpose.

# Use

The order type contains a range of parameters which affect the way the order is processed.

For example, using the order type, you can specify
 - The **number ranges** to be used for the orders
 - Which criteria are used when selecting a **routing**
 - How the order is to be costed.

MaintenanceOrder.description:
# Definition

Key that uniquely identifies an **order** within a **client**.

MaintenanceOrderType.description:
# Definition

Key that differentiates **orders** according to their purpose.

# Use

The order type contains a range of parameters which affect the way the order is processed.

For example, using the order type, you can specify
 - The **number ranges** to be used for the orders
 - Which criteria are used when selecting a **routing**
 - How the order is to be costed.

EAMProcessPhaseCodeDesc.description:
# Definition

This text appears when fixed values are displayed in the F4 help. It explains the possible input values.

See
 - **Task-Oriented Instructions**
 - **Reference Documentation for Semantic Properties of Domains**

MaintenanceOrder.description:
# Definition

Key that uniquely identifies an **order** within a **client**.

MaintenanceOrderOperation.description:
# Definition

**Production Planning**

Determines in which order the **operations** of a **sequence** are carried out.

**Project System**

Number that identifies an activity.

MaintenanceOrderSubOperation.description:
# Definition

Determines in which order the **sub-operations** of an **operation** are listed.

MaintenancePhaseControl.description:
# Definition

Indicates the key that differentiates phase control codes according to their assignment to order types and entity types.

# Use

Phase control codes help you define the user status in a maintenance order or an order operation. User status defines how the order or the order operation is processed.

# Example

You can define phase control code for an order to ensure that the order is not released. You can resolve a phase control code only if you have the required authorization key. The authorization key will help you release the order.

#

MaintenancePhaseControlText.description:
# Definition

Describes the phase control code.

# Use

You can enter details about the phase control code such as purpose, use, and so on.

# Example

MaintObjPhaseControlStateDesc.description:
# Definition

This text appears when fixed values are displayed in the F4 help. It explains the possible input values.

See
 - **Task-Oriented Instructions**
 - **Reference Documentation for Semantic Properties of Domains**

MaintObjPhaseCtrlCodeSetBy.description:
# Definition

Indicates the user who defined the phase control code.

# Use

You can view information about the user who defined the phase control code for a maintenance order or operation.

# Example

SAP USER

MaintObjPhseCtrlCodeRsetDteTme.description:
# Definition

The time when the phase control code was deactivated (UTC time stamp).

# Example

MaintObjPhseCtrlCodeSetDteTime.description:
# Definition

The time when the phase control code was activated (UTC time stamp).

# Example

MaintOrdProcessPhaseCode.description:
# Definition

A distinct stage in the end-to-end process of a maintenance work. These are fixed values that are used mainly for reporting and analytics. A phase is automatically determined for a notification, order, and operation when the system status is changed.

# Example

MaintProcgPhseCtrlActvtnCode.description:
# Definition

Indicates the key defined for the maintenance phase of a phase control.

# Use

When you define a phase control code, you can use the following controls:
 - Activate: When you define a phase control code for the Activate phase and subphase of a maintenance order or an order operation, the phase control code is active when the order or order operation reaches the phase and subphase.
 - Block: When you define phase control code for blocking phase and subphase of a maintenance order or an order operation, the phase and subphase are blocked. When you block a phase or subphase, the maintenance order or order operation is not processed during that subphase.

**Maintenance phase** is derived with from the combination of process phase and process subphase.

# Example
 - Activate:

Process Phase -Maintenance Order Execution

Process Subphase - Ready for Execution
 - Block:

|Process Phase - Maintenance Order Preparation

|Process Subphase - In Preparation

MaintProcgPhseCtrlActvtnDesc.description:
# Definition

This text appears when fixed values are displayed in the F4 help. It explains the possible input values.

See
 - **Task-Oriented Instructions**
 - **Reference Documentation for Semantic Properties of Domains**

# Definition

This text appears when fixed values are displayed in the F4 help. It explains the possible input values.

See
 - **Task-Oriented Instructions**
 - **Reference Documentation for Semantic Properties of Domains**

# Definition

Key that uniquely identifies an **order** within a **client**.

MaintenanceOrderType.description:
# Definition

Key that differentiates **orders** according to their purpose.

# Use

The order type contains a range of parameters which affect the way the order is processed.

For example, using the order type, you can specify
 - The **number ranges** to be used for the orders
 - Which criteria are used when selecting a **routing**
 - How the order is to be costed.

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification which the event uses. This enables the interpretation of the context.

type.description: Type of occurrence which has happened. Often this property is used for routing, observability, policy enforcement, etc.

subject.description: The subject of the event in the context of the event producer (identified by source).

time.description: Timestamp of when the occurrence happened. Must adhere to RFC 3339.
